---
title: "settings.json"
---

## High-level description
This file, `.vscode/settings.json`, defines project-specific settings for Visual Studio Code. It configures various extensions and features, including Python formatting, Rust analyzer settings, Python analysis, and ESLint working directories for different front-end projects.

## Table of contents
- Workspace settings for Python
- Workspace settings for Rust
- Workspace settings for ESLint

## Symbols
### Symbol Name: `.vscode/settings.json`
#### Description:
This file contains workspace settings for Visual Studio Code, customizing the editor's behavior for this specific project.

#### Internal Logic:
The file uses a JSON object to define key-value pairs for different settings. 

- `"[python]"`:  Sets the default formatter for Python files to "ms-python.black-formatter", enforcing code style consistency using the Black formatter.
- `"rust-analyzer.linkedProjects"`: Configures the Rust Analyzer extension to link to the project located at "./server/Cargo.toml".
- `"rust-analyzer.showUnlinkedFileNotification"`: Disables notifications for unlinked files by the Rust Analyzer.
- `"rust-analyzer.server.path"`: Specifies the path to the Rust Analyzer server executable.
- `"python.analysis.typeCheckingMode"`: Enables basic type checking for Python code.
- `"python.analysis.autoImportCompletions"`: Enables auto-completion suggestions for imports in Python files.
- `"eslint.workingDirectories"`: Defines an array of working directories for the ESLint linter, targeting different front-end projects ("chat", "dashboard", "search", "analytics"). This ensures that ESLint correctly analyzes and reports issues within each specific project context.
